title: Templates
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
Write code once, use for any type. 
`template <typename T>`.
Compiler generates function for each used type (Instantiation).
syntax: template <class T> T add(T a, T b) { return a+b; }

examples.code:
vector<int> v; // vector is a Class Template.
add<int>(1, 2); // Function Template.

common_mistakes.correction: Template definitions must be in Header files. Compiler needs code to instantiate.
